channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Waymarker removed from gate and path obstructed, 21st August
item.description:
The waymarker has been removed from the fence/kissing gate at the access to the PRoW off Brockhampton lane and the path obstructed by a field gate further down. This has been done without notice or any apparent application for closure/diversion
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The whole stretch of Brockhampton Lane from the barriers to The Hyde lane end is in a terrible state. The road is extremely uneven. The most recent repairs are pathetic. Thereâ€™s a length of tarmac been placed which in itself is extremely uneven, the edges have given way already and the huge dip beyond was untouched and the repair finished to that., 21st August
item.description:
The section on the long straight is particularly uneven and when cycling you are compelled to go along the middle of the road. However recently cracks have opened in the middle of the road which are wide enough to swallow a cycle tyre. Highly dangerous and the same has happpened at the other side of the railway crossing. Is it not time this road was fully resurfaced? Many cyclists go along here in preference to the dangerous Hyde lane. This must be the worst road in Gloucestershire. Please do something!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tarmac Path needs cracks filling, 21st August
item.description:
The path is from St Michael's Road leading to Lauriston Park. Near no6 light on the path is the worst section.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Saint Michaels Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 21st August
item.description:
Customer reports that there are cones at the location (and around the roundabout) but no work is being done - they are there for no apparent reason. This has been the case for a while and it is causing chaos. If these cones aren't removed, they will do it themselves.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 21st August
item.description:
Customer reports that the works at the location are scheduled to end tomorrow. However, they feel that, given the current progress being made, this will not be the case and the end of the road will be blocked for longer (Permit expires at 2359 on 22/08/2025); they have concerns the road won't reopen, as access for residents has been problematic already. Furthermore, they have received no notification from the developer and no warning of what's happening. Please can Highways investigate and confirm when the works will be gone.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole road surface in an unsafe condition, 21st August
item.description:
The whole of Bayshill Road, but particularly approaching and over the pedestrian crossing is a terrible surface for cycling and needs to be completely resurfaced for both safety and comfort.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Bayshill Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road marking need to be redone, 21st August
item.description:
Road marking outside the property need to be reinstated/redone Road markings were a yellow criss-cross box and the words KEEP CLEAR The first four houses have a no parking zig zag lines but there are none at the following four houses this means that members of the public park in front of the driveways (local school in the area)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Glynrosa Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues
